ancestors.content: @derthomas If I buy an electric car (unlikely because I live on $1200 a month) it would be a BYD, now available here in Mexico but not the US thanks to the stupid Trump/Biden tariffs.

@farbel @derthomas
The tariffs on #Chinese #BYD #EV's are necessary b/c #China is engaging in "dumping"... the illegal practice of selling something for less that it costs to make it in order to drive the competition out of business.

#Mexico can survive that b/c they don't have their own Mexican Owned EV manufacturers.

account.note: Formerly @MugsysRapSheet on Twitter. Historian. Setting the record straight when Conservatives try to rewrite history... with a touch of humor & plenty of (unavoidable) sarcasm. 😜

ancestors.content:
@MugsysRapSheet @farbel @derthomas Nah, the Biden administration just says that to protect our shitty companies.

BYD cars are even cheaper in China than abroad and genuinely seem to bring company profits with each sale.

@ikanreed @farbel @derthomas
We don't put tariffs on #EV's from other countries, just #China.

KIA is a Korean car maker that assembles its cars in Mexico, yet there is no tariff on them.

account.note: Formerly @MugsysRapSheet on Twitter. Historian. Setting the record straight when Conservatives try to rewrite history... with a touch of humor & plenty of (unavoidable) sarcasm. 😜

ancestors.content: @MugsysRapSheet @ikanreed @farbel @derthomas Mexico is part of NAFTA, one would hope there aren’t US tariffs on products made there.

account.note: Well, this can’t be more useless than my Google Buzz account. Or can it? Let’s find out.

ancestors.content: @smiteri @MugsysRapSheet @ikanreed @derthomas Pretty sure BYD is not manufacturing here.

@farbel @smiteri @MugsysRapSheet @derthomas ultimately the problem is the overcapacity claims are baseless, and there's no data to support the charge of dumping.

China's export ratio on cars and solar panels and the other tariffed goods are LOWER than other nations.

Total EV industry subsidies in China are lower than in the US.

The scant actual material evidence cited by our economists mostly amount to "the government has more control over who gets loans from banks"

@ikanreed @farbel @smiteri @derthomas
"Dumping" doesn't refer to a "quantity".

It refers to the practice of selling something for less than it cost your competition to make it to drive them out of business.

account.note: Formerly @MugsysRapSheet on Twitter. Historian. Setting the record straight when Conservatives try to rewrite history... with a touch of humor & plenty of (unavoidable) sarcasm. 😜

ancestors.content:
@MugsysRapSheet @farbel @smiteri @derthomas And there's no evidence to support that charge, either. They charge substantially more abroad than in the domestic market. If they were trying undercut and cut out in a anti-competitive way, that's exactly the opposite of what they'd do.

Face it, china developed green industry, we didn't. Biden wants to fix this by banning cheap cars.

@ikanreed @farbel @smiteri @derthomas
EVERY biz charges less domestically. No overseas shipping cost, worrying about Exchange Rates, or establishing local Support facilities. Plus, they pay their workers crap wages. And no competition b/c the gov't owns the company.

Just b/c #China charges their own population less doesn't mean they aren't under-pricing their #EV's in other countries.

You're absolutely correct on how they invested heavily in Green Tech. They're trying to corner the market.

account.note: Formerly @MugsysRapSheet on Twitter. Historian. Setting the record straight when Conservatives try to rewrite history... with a touch of humor & plenty of (unavoidable) sarcasm. 😜

ancestors.content: @MugsysRapSheet @ikanreed @smiteri @derthomas BYD is a publicly traded company. Warren Buffet has a large stake in it.

@farbel @ikanreed @smiteri @derthomas
How does that change anything?

They still sell their cars for less than they cost to make. They lose money on every sale.

account.note: Formerly @MugsysRapSheet on Twitter. Historian. Setting the record straight when Conservatives try to rewrite history... with a touch of humor & plenty of (unavoidable) sarcasm. 😜

ancestors.content: @MugsysRapSheet @ikanreed @smiteri @derthomas You claimed that the Chinese government owned the company. Slow down. Get your facts right. You are somewhat correct in your assessments.

@farbel @ikanreed @smiteri @derthomas
Even a gov't owned company can sell stock to raise funds. It doesn't make it a "publicly" owned company.

account.note: Formerly @MugsysRapSheet on Twitter. Historian. Setting the record straight when Conservatives try to rewrite history... with a touch of humor & plenty of (unavoidable) sarcasm. 😜

ancestors.content: @MugsysRapSheet @ikanreed @smiteri @derthomas BYD (BYD Company Limited) is a publicly-traded company with no Chinese government ownership. As of 2024, U.S. investors own over 60% of the company's public stock, including 9.9% owned by Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway. BYD's stock is listed on the Hong Kong and Shenzhen Stock Exchanges.

@farbel @ikanreed @smiteri @derthomas
If it's in #China, the gov't owns it. Period. They're a Communist gov't. That's how things work.

account.note: Formerly @MugsysRapSheet on Twitter. Historian. Setting the record straight when Conservatives try to rewrite history... with a touch of humor & plenty of (unavoidable) sarcasm. 😜

ancestors.content:
@MugsysRapSheet @farbel @smiteri @derthomas yeah, that's what it comes down to, you assume China=communism=bad and basically have no evidencial grounds for the more specific positions you hold about them.

What leads to this kind of competitive advantage aren't any form of "cheating" but a side effect from development policy emphasizing productive industry over profitable industry. Which admittedly IS a Marxist idea.

@ikanreed @farbel @smiteri @derthomas
I have asserted no conclusion as the whether "Communism=bad" or arguing against BYD b/c they're Chinese.

I only assert the FACT that EVERY Chinese business... even "publicly traded" ones... are still owned by the Chinese gov't and can therefore absorb selling products at a loss in order to manipulate the market.

They've been doing this LONG before BYD started making EV's. The fact so few products are "American Made" today are due to this.

account.note: Formerly @MugsysRapSheet on Twitter. Historian. Setting the record straight when Conservatives try to rewrite history... with a touch of humor & plenty of (unavoidable) sarcasm. 😜

ancestors.content:
@MugsysRapSheet @farbel @smiteri @derthomas I'm trying not to be too confrontational here, but do you realize the absence of a mechanism of action in your proposed theory?

Do you see the (let's be honest, kinda weirdly racist) short circuit in your thinking?

How does the Chinese government achieve this result? The reality I see is that they subsidized a little bit of industrial development but didn't spend nearly as much as we did making Elon musk the richest man on the planet.

descendants.content: @MugsysRapSheet @farbel @smiteri @derthomas nah it's a long standing racist trope to suggest normal things done by Asian people are somehow sneaky trickery when they're done well. I sense it because you constantly seem to assume that given essentially zero evidence.

@ikanreed @farbel @smiteri @derthomas
You think there is "zero evidence" #China has a LONG history of "dumping" to drive its competition out of the market?

I suggest you check some of your clothing labels.

And you think there is "zero evidence" China continues to burn massive amounts of coal WHILE investing heavily in #GreenTech?

If SCOTLAND were engaging the same practices, I'd be saying the same thing about *them*. This isn't "racial".

account.note: Formerly @MugsysRapSheet on Twitter. Historian. Setting the record straight when Conservatives try to rewrite history... with a touch of humor & plenty of (unavoidable) sarcasm. 😜

descendants.content:
@MugsysRapSheet @ikanreed @farbel @smiteri @derthomas

So, they are behaving like politicians and business people from any other race or ethnic group?

Or, are you suggesting that #ethical and #moral attitudes and behaviour are somehow #racially or #ethnically defined and pre-determined?

There appears to be some disturbingly race [ethnic group] based laws in #China heavily preferencing Han Chinese and dispossessing and oppressing other #ethnic groups. Almost like they have been #colonising surrounding areas.

There are no doubt racisit #Chinese [like there are racists in most ethnic groups], although you probably need to have control of the power of the state for that racism to be codified in law. Which is basically the definition of #racism the institutionalised preferencing of one ethnic group at the detriment of other groups.

Doesn’t mean all people from a certain ethnic group are #racist. You can’t choose your #family, nor State enforced Educational mind-moulding.

How do you say “Ethno-Nationalism is a stupid idea in any language”, in your language?

descendants.content:
@Global_Repercussions @MugsysRapSheet @farbel @smiteri @derthomas

Jesus Christ. "There appears to be some disturbingly race [ethnic group] based laws in China"

Here we go again with vague horseshit, you mentally rewrite through racist assumptions about the country that don't hold up to any scrutiny whatsoever. None.

China has a few very specific laws pertaining to ethnicity

Character limit means I'll have to make this a thread. 1/

@Global_Repercussions @MugsysRapSheet @farbel @smiteri @derthomas

The laws that directly reference ethnicity aren't that many

1. The preservation of ethnic autonomous regions. The reason for this have to do with the ways regions such as tibet, xinjiang, and inner mongolia became part of china(through treaties). These laws guarantee a degree of freedom from central government authority not granted to say Hunan or Beijing, with the specific intention of preserving ethnic tradition

2/

@Global_Repercussions @MugsysRapSheet @farbel @smiteri @derthomas

1(cont). In particular there are laws limiting non-tibetan tourism and settling in Xizang to prevent colonization. This law should be understood through lens of a specific concession won by the Tibetan people during the Qing Dynasty that the PRC decided to uphold when they "held on to" Tibet despite the parties within Tibet who wanted independence during the 60s. Ironically it's easier for me, a white american to go there

3/

@Global_Repercussions @MugsysRapSheet @farbel @smiteri @derthomas

than someone born in yunnan or any of the neighboring regions. It can be done, I know Chinese people who go, but it's basically like visiting a foreign country in terms of visa requirements(and non-tourist areas are off limits).

So finally

2. There are laws guaranteeing ethnic groups minimum levels of representation in the national government. China has hundreds of native ethnic minority groups, and each one is

4/

@Global_Repercussions @MugsysRapSheet @farbel @smiteri @derthomas

Guaranteed seats on the CPC, enough seats that they are all over-represented compared to their population. This is widely considered a good thing because the 97% Han majority could easily threaten political dominance without it through normal party elections.

Politics is a bit different in China, in that there isn't really a partisan element to factionalism in the national party.

@Global_Repercussions @MugsysRapSheet @farbel @smiteri @derthomas

3. Unlike the US, China still practices affirmative action in university admission and distribution of government jobs. I don't have a lot to say about this, it's a necessary corrective to systemic racism, even if it's not enough.

Now, how you twisted these 3 classes of policy into "Han favoritism" is what I'd personally call "intellectual dishonesty"

They have racism problems, but legally entrenched favoritism isn't one.

@ikanreed @MugsysRapSheet @farbel @smiteri @derthomas

I am happy to be corrected and would defer to others with more detailed understanding. My view is limited by Western media and reporting.

I meant to raise some general points about racism, not make specific points about China.

It would be some relief to know that Government and social treatment of #Uyghurs, #Tibetans and occupants of #hongkong are not driven or influenced by racism.
